ai.summary: Bradfield Woods Orange Route is a 6.3 km moderate woodland hike in the UK. The route winds through mixed woodland, open glades and occasional damp sections, offering a peaceful forest experience with gentle elevation changes.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly well-marked forest paths with some uneven ground, tree roots and small steps. Expect a mix of shaded woodland and open clearings, with occasional muddy patches after rain.
ai.safety_notes: Wear sturdy, waterproof footwear and dress in layers. Check the forecast and daylight hours before setting out. Stay on marked paths; be mindful of muddy and slippery sections. Insect protection and sun awareness are recommended. Carry a map, compass or offline navigation, a small first aid kit, enough water and snacks. Tell someone your plan and expected return time; bring a flashlight or headlamp if you might be out near dusk.
recommended_gear: Map or offline navigation (GPS as backup)
ai.best_seasons: Spring, summer and autumn are ideal, with cooler temperatures and less mud than winter; winter visits are possible but can be muddy and daylight is limited.

seo.title: Bradfield Woods Orange Route – 6.3 km Moderate Woodland Hike (UK)
seo.meta_description: Discover the Bradfield Woods Orange Route, a 6.3 km moderate woodland hike in the UK. Terrain, safety tips and gear for a enjoyable trail experience.
